title: Glacier National Park: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety             Have Fun and Stay Safe               Water   Water is the number one cause of fatalities in Glacier National Park. Please use extreme caution near water.         Steep Terrain   Many accidents occur when people fall after stepping off trails or roadsides, or by venturing onto very steep slopes.              Bears   An icon of wilderness, Glacier is home to large numbers of both black and grizzly bears.        Mountain Lions   Take precautions to protect you and your children from an accidental encounter.        Other Wildlife   Always enjoy wildlife from the safety of your car or from a safe distance. Do not approach wildlife to take photographs.
